Title: Facebook's Secret Plan: Help people be lazy

Author: blored
Title: What do we think of Tandem Entrepreneurs...
Content: An incubator that invests more money than ycombinator but takes much more equity.  They are supposed to follow you through to a liquidity event and put sweat and knowledge into your app.  Good deal?

Author: Tobias42
Content: The unemployment rate in Germany currently is 8.8%. Bad enough, but far from 10-20%. In the East there are some regions with more than 20% unemployment, but on the other hand in the prosperous southern states (Baden-Wurttemberg, Bavaria) it is about 5-6%.

Author: blored
Title: Three things every entrepreneur must know...
Content:
1) Lists like these are just link bait.

2) Working won't get you girls.

3) It's hard.

Author: danw
Title: In Search of the Silver Bullet

Author: dpapathanasiou
Content:
I never saw the rationale for the government making risky investments, just because purportedly because nobody else does.

Risk is important because it offers incentives to the marketplace, and prevents economic systems falling into stagnation (local optima), as Aaron Brown describes in this interview: http://marketplacemoney.publicradio.org/display/web/2006/05/...

But I agree with you that it is not the government which should be taking those risks, since (as others have pointed out in this thread), governments really don't know what they're doing in that regard.

Author: geebee
Content: Yeah, it was just a guess.  But I figure that after someone has had enough time to get complacent, he/she's probably at a pretty senior level and is making more dough.

Author: mmaunder
Title: Brand Authority and the Milgram Experiment
Content: ...The experiment found that few people have the resources needed to resist authority, even when the authority figure is telling them to do something in violent opposition to their moral judgment. Brands carry a level of authority. Take a startup for example...

Author: adamdoupe
Content:
I think the part about the iPhone is a bit convoluted. The author wraps up the phone and the service, which are not the same thing.

A more accurate comparison would be the difference in the price of the iPhone service vs. previous service. This all assumes that you already have a cell phone, which I believe is a fair assumption.

Author: rchambers
Title: Could Facebook Become The Next Microsoft?
Content: Amongst all the noise today over Facebook's acquisition of Parakey, little has been said on what the acquisition means for Facebook in the broader sense.

Author: hello_moto
Content: Isn't that people in Silicon Valley (especially those who work at Internet companies) never stick with their companies more than 3-5 years? (except the execs)
